title: Beatings, deprivation, torture, rape: Palestinians speak of the 'hell' of Israeli prisons
summary: Since October 7, 18 Palestinian detainees have died in Israeli detention centers, and dozens more in army-run camps. Physicians for Human Rights Israel has denounced 'continuous and systematic abuse by prison staff.'

title: NATO summit: Macron returns to 'center of the photo' for 36 hours
summary: In Washington, the French president boasted to his allies about sidelining his foreign policy opponents in France. However, returning to Paris, where his letter to the French has been criticized, will be more challenging.

title: Alec Baldwin walks free after manslaughter trial dismissed over withheld evidence
summary: Baldwin's lawyers argued that bullets given to police and reportedly linked to the case should have been disclosed to the defense. The judge dismissed the case, citing misconduct.

title: In Sudan, war is raging on the ashes of the revolution
summary: The conflict has now drawn several armed groups into its wake. Many civilians are forced to choose between joining up or exile, and society is becoming polarized as weapons circulate more freely than basic commodities.

title: US election: Biden reaffirms his desire to 'finish the job'
summary: On Thursday, amid a health controversy and following his disastrous debate with Donald Trump, the US president held his first press conference since November 2023.

title: Five campsites to discover in Ile-de-France, from Val-d'Oise to Seine-et-Marne
summary: Set in the heart of 5 hectares of greenery in Boulancourt, on an island in Maisons-Laffitte, or beside a lake in Nesles-la-Vallée, these camping establishments provide all the delights of the great outdoors or Paris, or both!

title: French rugby players charged with aggravated rape in Argentina
summary: The two players, Hugo Auradou, 20, and Oscar Jegou, 21, have had the charges for which they have been accused upgraded from 'sexual assault' to 'aggravated rape,' which is punishable by up to 20 years of imprisonment.

title: Woolly mammoth genome reconstructed in 3D from fossil chromosomes
summary: For the first time, scientists have demonstrated that the three-dimensional architecture of chromosomes can be preserved under very specific conditions. A discovery that opens a window on the past, on the biology of extinct species.

title: Monnaie de Paris exhibition charts design history of Olympic medals
summary: Paris's mint, which has produced the awards for the Paris 2024 Olympic and Paralympic Games, presents the evolution of the medals since 1896.

summary: A study conducted by researchers at the University of California, Berkeley, has revealed the presence of lead and arsenic in menstrual tampons. The effects could be potentially harmful to the kidneys, liver and neurological system.

title: Ashdod, 20 kilometers from the war in Gaza, is an enclave of the Israeli right
summary: The majority of residents of the port city don't believe there is a solution that will allow Israelis and Palestinians to live together, and there are no calls here for the war in Gaza to end.

title: Kenya's President Ruto dismisses his government and promises dialogue
summary: Two weeks after violent protests against a draft budget that included tax increases, the head of state claims to have 'listened to the people.'

title: Paris 2024: Why the Seine's high flow rate threatens the Games' opening ceremony
summary: Heavy spring and summer rainfall has swelled the river and its tributaries, as well as the four artificial reservoirs responsible for regulating them. The ceremony scheduled for July 26 could be adapted.

title: Nepal: Two buses carrying at least 60 people were swept into a river by landslide
summary: Three survivors apparently swam to safety, but rescuers by late morning had not found any trace of the buses, which likely were submerged and swept downstream in the Trishuli River.

summary: According to the French maritime police, the four people died off Boulogne sur Mer on France's northern coast while trying to cross to Britain. Others were rescued alive.

summary: The number of human beings is set to peak at 10.3 billion in 2080, according to a United Nations report published on Thursday. It will then begin to decline before the end of the century.

title: French elections: Business leaders are increasingly worried
summary: Business leaders have reaffirmed their hostility to the left's policy platform and called for a coalition government to maintain the supply-side policy pursued over the last 10 years.

summary: Israel is increasing its evacuation orders, forcing 2 million Gazans to move relentlessly, in enclosures demarcated by military installations.

summary: Both the right and Macron deny that the left-wing Nouveau Front Populaire bloc has won the snap elections, increasing the pressure on the alliance.

summary: Tech billionaire Elon Musk's X platform is misleading users with its blue checkmarks for certified accounts, and is also violating EU content rules, according to regulators.

summary: The Paris police prefecture has set out perimeters of movement restrictions around the sites of the Olympic competitions and the opening ceremony. Public transport networks will also be disrupted.

summary: The Israeli army carried out days of bombardments in the districts of Tal al-Hawa and Sanaa in Gaza City, as war enters its tenth month.

summary: The judge criticized the former mayor of New York City and Trump ally, saying he exhibited 'uncooperative conduct'.

summary: Fernando Villavicencio, a former investigative journalist who promised to combat corruption and drug trafficking, was shot dead just days before the 2023 election.

summary: Sports Minister Amélie Oudéa-Castéra took a dip in Paris' Seine river on Saturday, two weeks before the start of the Games.

summary: Inhabitants of the Phlegrean Fields seismic zone are suspicious of the public authorities' earthquake prevention efforts due to numerous past embezzlements and misappropriations.

summary: The virus has already eliminated one of yellow jersey's team-mates, as it spreads through the peloton. This raises sporting uncertainties ahead of eight climbs across Saturday and Sunday.
